basic_info.description: I am Tsay Yong, an aspiring software engineer who has been at it since 2017, currently based in Singapore. I am a full-stack developer, with Javascript(~3 YOE) and Python(~5 YOE) as my languages of choice. Having taken part in tons of startup hackathons, as well as done plenty of personal projects, I have good experience with cross-platform development frameworks, for building mobile applications, alongside great backend development experience with frameworks like Django.
basic_info.description_2: With approximately five years of experience in YouTube content creation and various video production endeavors, I have developed extensive expertise in the realm of digital marketing and visual computing (click on portfolio switch to learn more). Moreover, my recent exploration of finance has piqued my interest, leading me to delve into investment research for personal enjoyment. I find games of probabilities, such as Poker, particularly captivating, and I am eager to explore potential opportunities in fields such as quantitative trading that show great relation to the great game of skilled chance.
basic_info.description_bold: I am excited to help you or your organization build the next big thing.

projects.title: Pixorift
projects.description: The base concept of this App is that it is a game, in which players have to find particular objects in the world to photograph. Upon taking that photo, the app then uses Machine Learning to do object recognition and if it passes the test case, the user then receives game points. The app has social aspects to allow users to share their progress with each other.

projects.title: Class Minecraft Server
projects.description: During the COVID-19 lockdown, many of my classmates were bored to tears at home. Hence, we decided to start a Minecraft Server to kill time, in which I ran with my coding knowledge. To create a unique experience, I wrote custom plugins (modifications to the game) for the server in order to let the players have a more enjoyable time, in the process, learn Java.

projects.title: ZapQ - A Virtual Queuing App
projects.description: During the COVID-19 pandemic, it was dangerous to spend excessive time outside due to transmission risk - one such high risk activity was queuing. This app aims to ditch the physical queue, adopting one virtually instead.
